body_html:
Yes, it is intended. Note that the ops are added to updates_collections=ops.GraphKeys.UPDATE_OPS, and will not be updated immediately, but later (why it is called "delayed") before the loss computation here.

On the other hand, _force_updates() will immediately update the moving mean and var, noting the added control dependencies.
body_text:
Yes, it is intended. Note that the ops are added to updates_collections=ops.GraphKeys.UPDATE_OPS, and will not be updated immediately, but later (why it is  called "delayed") before the loss computation here.
On the other hand, _force_updates() will immediately update the moving mean and var, noting the added control dependencies.
body:
Yes, it is intended. Note that the ops are added to updates_collections=ops.GraphKeys.UPDATE_OPS, and will not be updated immediately, but later (why it is  called "delayed") before the loss computation [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.0/tensorflow/contrib/training/python/training/training.py#L414).

On the other hand, _force_updates() will immediately update the moving mean and var, noting the added [control dependencies](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.0/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/layers.py#L333).
